data.title: Simple Fuzzy Search
data.solution:
search = gets.chomp.downcase
n = gets.to_i
out = []

n.times do
    name = gets.chomp
    search_ind = 0
    name.each_char do |char|
        search_ind += 1 if char.downcase == search[search_ind]
    end
    out << name if search_ind == search.size
end

puts out.empty? ? "NONE" : out
data.statement:
Most modern code editors allow users to search for a file typing only some of the characters that compose its name, without caring about the adjacency of the characters as long as they appear in the same order. For example, instead of typing "AFileWithABigFancyName.js" in the search bar, the user could type only "AFWABFNjs", "bigfancy" or "filwbifam.js" and the file would appear in the results.

Given a search string [[search]] and [[N]] file names, your task is to print in order of appearance which files match the given search string, considering only the order of the characters and not their adjacency. The search must be case insensitive and if no file names match the search string output {{NONE}}.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
filwbifam.js
6
AFileWithABigFancyName.js
FilterWebIframes.js
FloodFill.py
find_blocks_with_bifurcative_molecules.js
find_blocks_with_bifurcative_molecules.rb
Filter.Web.Iframes.Joining.Servers.jar

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testIn:
yyz
5
yz.yx
TryToFindPythagoreanTriple.mz
yyz.mp3
fyle_wythout_extenzion
zyyy.z

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
a
10
big_string_without_this_letter
a
aa
a.app
c.cpp
wxyz.a
another_big_string_without_this_letter_wait_ooops
bbbb.c
qr_code_reader.py
A
testCases.testOut:
a
aa
a.app
wxyz.a
another_big_string_without_this_letter_wait_ooops
qr_code_reader.py
A

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 10
1 ≤ length([[search]]), length([[name]]) ≤ 50
The strings [[search]] and [[name]] may only contain underscores, dots and alphanumeric characters.
data.stubGenerator:
read search:string(100)
read N:int
loop N read name:string(100)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> The search string [[search]].
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of file names.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A string [[name]] for the file name.
data.outputDescription: The file names that match the search string in order of appearance, or {{NONE}} if there's no match.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Most modern code editors allow users to search for a file typing only some of the characters that compose its name, without caring about the adjacency of the characters as long as they appear in the same order. For example, instead of typing "AFileWithABigFancyName.js" in the search bar, the user could type only "AFWABFNjs", "bigfancy" or "filwbifam.js" and the file would appear in the results.

Given a search string search and N file names, your task is to print in order of appearance which files match the given search string, considering only the order of the characters and not their adjacency. The search must be case insensitive and if no file names match the search string output NONE.
Input
Line 1: The search string search.
Line 2: An integer N for the number of file names.
Next N lines: A string name for the file name.
Output
The file names that match the search string in order of appearance, or NONE if there's no match.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10
1 ≤ length(search), length(name) ≤ 50
The strings search and name may only contain underscores, dots and alphanumeric characters.
Example
Input
filwbifam.js
6
AFileWithABigFancyName.js
FilterWebIframes.js
FloodFill.py
find_blocks_with_bifurcative_molecules.js
find_blocks_with_bifurcative_molecules.rb
Filter.Web.Iframes.Joining.Servers.jar
Output
AFileWithABigFancyName.js
FilterWebIframes.js
find_blocks_with_bifurcative_molecules.js
Filter.Web.Iframes.Joining.Servers.jar
